SEARCH

Class EmailService

java.lang.Object
EmailService
public class EmailService extends Object
Service class responsible for sending emails using the Jakarta Mail API.

This class encapsulates the SMTP configuration (specifically for Gmail) and handles the authentication and message transmission logic.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zainab

  • Constructor Details

    • EmailService

      public EmailService(String username, String password)
      Constructs an EmailService with specific credentials.
      Parameters:
      username - The SMTP username (sender's email address).
      password - The SMTP password or App Password.

  • Method Details

    • createPasswordAuthentication

      jakarta.mail.PasswordAuthentication createPasswordAuthentication()
      Creates a PasswordAuthentication object.

      This method is package-private to facilitate unit testing by allowing this logic to be overridden or mocked if necessary.

      Returns:
      A new PasswordAuthentication instance with the stored credentials.

    • sendEmail

      public void sendEmail(String to, String subject, String body)
      Sends an email to a specified recipient.

      Configures SMTP properties for Gmail (TLS, port 587) and initiates a session. Catches MessagingException and wraps it in a RuntimeException.

      Parameters:
      to - The recipient's email address.
      subject - The subject line of the email.
      body - The body text of the email.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the email fails to send due to authentication or connection issues.

    • sendReminder

      public void sendReminder(String to, String subject, String body)
      Sends a reminder email.

      This is a convenience wrapper around sendEmail(String, String, String).

      Parameters:
      to - The recipient's email address.
      subject - The subject of the reminder.
      body - The content of the reminder.
